subject: Investing
title: The All-Weather Portfolio Concept
description: Learn The All-Weather Portfolio Concept in one minute.

hook.text: Ray Dalio built a portfolio designed to perform in any economic environment‚Äîgrowth, recession, or inflation.

buildup.text: The all-weather idea splits assets across four scenarios: rising growth, falling growth, rising inflation, falling inflation.

discovery.text: A typical mix: 30% stocks, 40% long bonds, 15% intermediate bonds, 7.5% gold, 7.5% commodities.

twist.text: It reduces drawdowns significantly but sacrifices upside in strong bull markets compared to 100% stocks.

climax.text: The trade-off is intentional: smaller peaks, but far shallower valleys and better sleep at night.

punchline.text: The best portfolio is the one you can stick with through any storm.

quiz.question: What is the goal of an all-weather portfolio?
options: Perform reasonably in any economic environment
